bug.author: MaximBazarov
bug.description:
Facing this issue using Google Colab # Install libraries - you might need to restart the runtime after doing this !pip install turicreate==5.6 # The wrong version of mxnet will be installed !pip uninstall -y mxnet # Install CUDA10-compatible version of mxnet !pip install mxnet-cu100
import turicreate as tc tc.config.set_num_gpus(-1)
print('### Labeling images') images = tc.load_images('2images') images['labels'] = images['path'].element_slice(8,-4)
print('### one_shot_object_detector creation...') model = tc.one_shot_object_detector.create(images, 'labels')
print('### one_shot_object_detector evaluation...') model.evaluate(data)
print('### exporting Model ') # Export to Core ML model.export_coreml('grn.mlmodel') Error: <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-8-15dc8702d986> in <module>() 10 images['labels'] = images['path'].element_slice(8,-4) 11 ---> 12 model = tc.one_shot_object_detector.create(images, 'labels') 13 14 model.evaluate(data)
3 frames /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/turicreate/toolkits/_mxnet/__init__.py in __getattribute__(self, attr) 18 import mxnet 19 ---> 20 version_tuple = tuple(int(x) for x in mxnet.__version__.split('.') if x.isdigit()) 21 lowest_version = (0, 11, 0) 22 not_yet_supported_version = (1, 2, 0)
AttributeError: module 'mxnet' has no attribute '__version__' </denchmark-code>

comments.comment:
TuriCreate does not support CUDA 10. TuriCreate currently uses MXNet for its deep learning. The latest version of MXNet which works with TuriCreate is 1.1.0. The first version of MXNet to support CUDA 10 is 1.3.1. Do you need CUDA 10? Or would CUDA 9 work? We support CUDA 9. It looks like you have several different CUDA version of MXNet installed: <denchmark-code>mxnet-cu100==1.4.0.post0 mxnet-cu80==1.1.0 mxnet-cu90==1.1.0 </denchmark-code>
You should only have one of these packages installed. I would try CUDA 9 and uninstall the other version. Run pip uninstall mxnet-cu100 mxnet-cu90 and see if that works.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TobyRoseman>@TobyRoseman</denchmark-link> thanks for the hints! I basically want to make it work on GPU, doesn't really matter what CUDA would be used along the way. <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1GaJLOhdrN-OG8zsL4vgo-wBcqJh6CPYv>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1GaJLOhdrN-OG8zsL4vgo-wBcqJh6CPYv</denchmark-link>
here's. it the whole notebook

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MaximBazarov>@MaximBazarov</denchmark-link> - you may only be able to use a specific version of CUDA with Google Colab. Did you try what I suggested (uninstalling and )? Did it work?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TobyRoseman>@TobyRoseman</denchmark-link> yes it worked till some point, there's a workaround to install CUDA 8 into the Google Colab: <denchmark-code>nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2016 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Tue_Jan_10_13:22:03_CST_2017 Cuda compilation tools, release 8.0, V8.0.61 </denchmark-code>
but at some point it crashes with out of memory <denchmark-code>Installing collected packages: mxnet-cu80 Successfully installed mxnet-cu80-1.1.0 Augmenting input images using 951 background images. +------------------+--------------+------------------+ | Images Augmented | Elapsed Time | Percent Complete | +------------------+--------------+------------------+ | 0 | 5.84s | 0% | | 1 | 5.84s | 0% | | 2 | 5.85s | 0% | | 3 | 5.86s | 0% | | 4 | 5.87s | 0% | | 5 | 5.89s | 0.25% | | 10 | 5.98s | 0.5% | | 50 | 6.98s | 2.5% | | 100 | 7.86s | 5.25% | | 500 | 16.99s | 26.25% | | 1000 | 32.47s | 52.5% | | 1500 | 43.40s | 78.75% | | 1901 | 51.44s | 99.75% | +------------------+--------------+------------------+ Using 'image' as feature column Using 'label' as annotations column --> crash * </denchmark-code>

We're tracking the out of memory error here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/2038>#2038</denchmark-link> . Since the original issues is resolved, I'm going to close this issue.
